      • SSAP_XMLTools

        public SSAP_XMLTools(java.lang.String nodeID,
             java.lang.String SMART_SPACE_NAME,
             java.lang.String ANYURI)
        Object constructor. To be able to use just the XML parser methods, all param can be null.
        Parameters:
        nodeID - the KPI node ID
        SMART_SPACE_NAME - the smart space name
        ANYURI - the URI you are going to use in the SIB

      • SSAP_XMLTools

        public SSAP_XMLTools()
        Object constructor. To be able to use just the XML parser methods

    • Method Detail

      • SibXMLMessageParser

        public java.util.Hashtable SibXMLMessageParser(java.lang.String xml,
                                      java.lang.String[] id)
        Collect all the values of each xml tag id specified into an hashtable looking for into a string representation of an xml document. All id passed are not mandatory to be found in this version.
        Parameters:
        xml - the xml documento to parse
        id - array of all xml tag to find into the document
        Returns:
        an hashtable containing all the couple id-value

      • autoCheckSibMessage

        public boolean autoCheckSibMessage(java.lang.String xml,
                          java.lang.String[] id,
                          java.lang.String[] ref)
        Check if every element of the id array have into the last SIB XML message a corresponding value from the ref array.
        Parameters:
        id - List of SIB XML message tag to check
        ref - references values for each tag id
        Returns:
        true if all the values into the last SIB XML message match with the values in the ref array, false otherwise. Each id is mandatory, so if the size of hashtable is less then id array, it will return false.

      • getParameterElement

        public org.jdom2.Element getParameterElement(java.lang.String xml,

                                    java.lang.String value)
        By specifying an xml attribute and value, the xml content will be return as Element object
        Parameters:
        xml - the xml SIB message
        attribute - the attribute you are looking for
        value - the value of the attribute
        Returns:
        the Element object that contain the attribute xml content

      • getQueryTriple

        public java.util.Vector<java.util.Vector<java.lang.String>> getQueryTriple(java.lang.String xml)
        Get all the triple as list of strings from a RDF query answer message
        Parameters:
        xml - the SIB xml message
        Returns:
        a list of all triples available in the xml SIB message passed. It is a structure to store every triple. Each element of the vector contains another vector formed by four string elements : -the subject -the predicate -the object -the subject type -the object type

      • getTripleObjectByPredicate

        public java.lang.String getTripleObjectByPredicate(java.util.Vector<java.util.Vector<java.lang.String>> triple_list,
                                          java.lang.String predicate)
        Get the first occurence of the Object in a triple by specify the Predicate value
        Parameters:
        triple_list - a list of triple string representation. It is a structure to store every triple. Each element of the vector contains another vector formed by five string elements : -the subject -the predicate -the object -the subject type -the object type
        predicate - xml SIB message triple predicate
        Returns:
        the string representation of the object

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • newTriple

        public java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> newTriple(java.lang.String s,
                                           java.lang.String p,
                                           java.lang.String o,
                                           java.lang.String s_type,
                                           java.lang.String o_type)
        This method makes one new query triple to add to the query to send to the SIB
        Parameters:
        s - the string representation of the subject. The value 'null' means any value
        p - the string representation of the predicate. The value 'null' means any value
        o - the string representation of the object. The value 'null' means any value
        s_type - the string representation of the subject type. Allowed values are: uri, literal
        o_type - the string representation of the object type. Allowed values are: uri, literal
        Returns:
        a string list representation of the triple

      • queryRDF

        public java.lang.String queryRDF(java.lang.String s,
                        java.lang.String p,
                        java.lang.String o,
                        java.lang.String s_type,
                        java.lang.String o_type)
        Make the RDF-QUERY SSAP message
        Parameters:
        s - the string representation of the subject.
        p - the string representation of the predicate. The value 'any' means any value
        o - the string representation of the object. the value 'any' means any value
        s_type - the string representation of the subject type. Allowed values are: uri, literal
        o_type - the string representation of the object type. Allowed values are: uri, literal
        Returns:
        a string representation of the XML answer message from the SIB

      • update

        public java.lang.String update(java.lang.String sn,
                      java.lang.String pn,
                      java.lang.String on,
                      java.lang.String sn_type,
                      java.lang.String on_type,
                      java.lang.String so,
                      java.lang.String po,
                      java.lang.String oo,
                      java.lang.String so_type,
                      java.lang.String oo_type)
        Make the UPDATE SSAP message New value to insert:
        Parameters:
        sn - the string representation of the subject.
        pn - the string representation of the predicate.
        on - the string representation of the object.
        sn_type - the string representation of the subject type. Allowed values are: uri, literal
        on_type - the string representation of the object type. Allowed values are: uri, literal Old value to replace:
        so - the string representation of the subject.
        po - the string representation of the predicate.
        oo - the string representation of the object.
        so_type - the string representation of the subject type. Allowed values are: uri, literal
        oo_type - the string representation of the object type. Allowed values are: uri, literal
        Returns:
        a string representation of the XML answer message from the SIB

      • update

        public java.lang.String update(java.util.Vector<java.util.Vector<java.lang.String>> newTripleVector,
                      java.util.Vector<java.util.Vector<java.lang.String>> oldTripleVector)
        Make the UPDATE SSAP message New value to insert:
        Parameters:
        newTripleVector - the structure to store every new triple to insert. Each element of the vector contains another vector formed by five string elements : -the string representation of the new subject -the string representation of the new predicate -the string representation of the new object -the string representation of the new subject type. Allowed values are: uri, literal -the string representation of the new object type. Allowed values are: uri, literal Old value to replace:
        oldTripleVector - the structure to store every old triple to replace. Each element of the vector contains another vector formed by five string elements : -the string representation of the old subject -the string representation of the old predicate -the string representation of the object -the string representation of the old subject type. Allowed values are: uri, literal -the string representation of the old object type. Allowed values are: uri, literal
        Returns:
        a string representation of the XML answer message from the SIB

      • queryWQL_VALUES

        public java.lang.String queryWQL_VALUES(java.lang.String startNodeURI,
                               java.lang.String type,
                               java.lang.String path)
        Make the WQL-QUERY SSAP message
        Parameters:
        startNodeURI - the string representation of the node URI
        type - the string representation of the node URI type. Can be "literal" or "URI"
        path - the string representation of the WQL graph path
        Returns:
        a string representation of the XML answer message from the SIB

      • queryWQL_RELATED

        public java.lang.String queryWQL_RELATED(java.lang.String startNodeURI,
                                java.lang.String startType,
                                java.lang.String endNodeURI,
                                java.lang.String endType,
                                java.lang.String path)
        Make the WQL-QUERY SSAP message
        Parameters:
        startNodeURI - the string representation of the start node URI
        startType - the string representation of the node URI type. Can be "literal" or "URI"
        endNodeURI - the string representation of the end node URI
        endType - the string representation of the node URI type. Can be "literal" or "URI"
        path - the string representation of the WQL graph path
        Returns:
        a string representation of the XML answer message from the SIB
